scenario:
Altria Group (MO) released its fourth-quarter results, beating expectations with adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.29 and revenues of $5.11 billion. The company saw growth in its smoke-free product segments, including a 44.4% increase in shipment volumes for on! nicotine pouches and a 15.3% hike in consumables' shipment volume for the NJOY segment. 

Key financial metrics include:
- Adjusted EPS: $1.29, a 9.3% increase from the previous year
- Revenues (net of excise taxes): $5.11 billion, a 1.6% increase from the previous year
- Adjusted OCI margin: 61.2%, a 220 basis point increase from the previous year
- Adjusted tax rate: 24.1%, a 50 basis point decrease from the previous year

The company has a new $1 billion share repurchase program and maintained its commitment to regular dividends. Altria is forecasting adjusted EPS growth of 2% to 5% for 2025, reflecting optimism tempered by regulatory and market challenges. The company's long-term prospects will depend on the effective deployment of its smoke-free strategy and ongoing product diversification efforts.
